    • ������ϸ����

      • dispatchInBackground

        public static <T> PcapTask<T> dispatchInBackground(Pcap pcap,
                                                   int cnt,
                                                   ByteBufferHandler<T> handler,
                                                   T data)
        Runs the dispatch function in a background thread. The function returns immediately and returns a PcapTask from which the user can interact with the background task.
        ���Ͳ���:
        T - User supplied type
        ����:
        pcap - an open pcap object
        cnt - number of packets to capture and exit, 0 for infinate
        handler - user supplied callback handler
        data - opaque, user supplied data object dispatched back to the handler
        ����:
        a task object which allows interaction with the underlying capture loop and thread

        public static byte[] getHardwareAddress(PcapIf netif)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves a network hardware address or MAC for a network interface.
        ����:
        netif - network device as retrieved from Pcap.findAllDevs().
        ����:
        network interface hardware address or null if unable to retrieve it
        �׳�:
        java.io.IOException - any communication errors

      • injectLoop

        public static <T> int injectLoop(int cnt,
                                 int id,
                                 PcapPacketHandler<T> handler,
                                 T user,
                                 PcapPacket packet)
        Inject loop.
        ���Ͳ���:
        T - user supplied type
        ����:
        cnt - number of packets
        id - dlt type
        handler - user packet handler
        user - user object
        packet - packet used for peering when using no copy mode
        ����:
        libpcap result code

      • injectLoop

        private static <T> int injectLoop(int cnt,
                                  int id,
                                  PcapPacketHandler<T> handler,
                                  T user,
                                  PcapPacket packet,
                                  JPacket.State state,
                                  PcapHeader header,
                                  JScanner scanner)
        A special method invokes the real native loop callback with fake pcap packets. The loop is used to test for memory leaks and performance that bypasses libpcap calls.
        ���Ͳ���:
        T - type of user data
        ����:
        cnt - the cnt
        id - the id
        handler - handler to dispatch the injected packet to
        user - user data
        packet - packet to inject into the loop and callback
        state - the state
        header - pcap header for this packet
        scanner - the scanner
        ����:
        number of packets injected
